subject: RE: [junit] How to test a main(String[] args) method?
msgSnippet: ... Nevertheless, it s an intriguing idea. Have you tried this, or is this off the top of your head? It seems like it would be a very good thing to do to get
messageBody:
>So said Brett Neumeier on 2003-07-23 --------------------
>Someone wrote (I deleted the original message, sorry):
>> > I whould like to test a class with a main(String[] args)
>> > method. Depending
>> > on the input argument it executes one thing or the other. The
>> > problem is
>> > that on my main(String[] args) method at the end or when it
>> > founds an error,
>> > the method System.exit() is invoked. So when I define jUnit test cases
>> > (methods with prefix test), jUnits only runs the first test,
>> > because some
>> > System.exit() was invoked.
>> >
>> > Is there any way to test such kind of situations?
>
>In general I second the suggestions made by Bernd and J. B.
>Rainsberger. However, that said, I think you /can/ test this as it
>currently is coded by using a security manager. If you run the JUnit
>test runner with a security manager present, and specify a security
>policy that doesn't allow the application code to call System.exit(),
>then what /should/ happen is that when the code calls System.exit(), a
>SecurityException will be thrown. You can catch that in your test code.
>
>To me this sounds like it would be more effort than following Bernd or
>J.B.'s recommendations, but I thought I'd mention it anyway in case you
>(or someone else) want to give it a try.

Nevertheless, it's an intriguing idea. Have you tried this, or is this off the top of your head?

It seems like it would be a very good thing to do to get to a "quick green" before refactoring towards Bernd's or my suggestion.
